channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Life Kit has tips on how to paint your rental
item.description: It might feel risky to make big, bold changes to a brand new apartment. But NPR's Life Kit has tips for making your space your own, without losing your security deposit.

item.title: Military parade marches on DC streets Saturday evening
item.description: Today is the day of the big military parade in Washington.

item.title: U.S. Senator Tina Smith reacts to Minnesota shootings
item.description: U.S. Senator Tina Smith talks to host Scott Detrow about the assassination of Minnesota lawmaker Melissa Hortman.

item.title: Gunman dressed as police officer kills prominent Minnesota lawmaker
item.description: In a shocking, apparent assassination, authorities say a gunman dressed as a police officer kill a prominent Minnesota lawmaker and her husband in her home, wounded another politician and his wife in another home and had other political targets in mind

item.title: No Kings protests take place across the country
item.description: No Kings protests will be held across the country. The protests are the same day as a military parade in Washington to celebrate the Army's 250th birthday.

item.title: Understanding the escalating tensions between Israel and Iran
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Charles Freilich, Israel's former deputy national security advisor, about the ongoing strikes taking place between Israel and Iran.

item.title: Archbishop of Chicago discusses tonight's Mass at Rate Field
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Cardinal Blase J. Cupich, Archbishop of Chicago, about the Mass being held in honor of Pope Leo XIV tonight at Rate Field.

item.title: Podcast series explores how LGBT people were treated during the Nazi era
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Eric Marcus about the latest season of his series Making Gay History, which explores the lives of LGBTQ people during the Nazi era.

item.title: Reporting on Medicaid in Kentucky
item.description: Today for our weekly reporter's notebook series, we talk to Kentucky Public Radio's Sylvia Goodman and Joe Sonka about their reporting on healthcare in that state.

item.title: Early voting for NYC's mayoral primary election begins this weekend
item.description: Eleven Democrats are running to replace New York City Mayor Eric Adams, who is running as an independent and bypassing the primary. Early voting for the primary election begins this weekend.
